text:
Didn’t see anyone call it out -

*The HubSpot Developer Slack just passed 1,000 members!*
but there are only like 250 active members
hey 25% activity is pretty good out of a 1000. :stuck_out_tongue:
yeah you right.
It is pretty active in here.
I’m super active right now
:partyparrot:
/poll "Are you an active person in this slack" "I am active" "I prefer to lurk and just watch"

I'm SUPER excited to see over 1000 of the :sprocket: HubSpot CMS developer community members in one spot, collaborating and helping each other! :sparkling_heart: I'm grateful to have everyone here - active or lurker. :pray:

Overall, 25% is actually really good. It's also measured on a "Weekly Active User" (WAU), so that means on average we have 250 users login to the slack each week. Which is pretty darn good. 6-Months ago it was ~80. WAU.  (There are a handful of really old users I could probably purge soon too.)

Plus, this is just the start of something big. Look at just the progress in 2018. It's early days still. This community is on fire :fire: right now. Let's keep helping each other, and keep the momentum going! :raised_hands::luke::raised_hands:
Is it somehow possible to subscribe to these updates, for example via email? <https://status.HubSpot.com>

As far as I’m aware, no, not without some third party tool that basically just checks the page for differences.

I’ve had a plan to integrate those updates into the <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension> but HubSpot would have to give me access to the API, seemed like a feature only the account owners of the status tool could use.

HS devs if interested in allowing the extension to notify of status page updates. Feel free to message me about it. I can explain what I need in order to make it possible.
I'll make a note - it's something we can explore
Would be neat to create an aggregate feed of all key things for developers: Status, API change log, product releases, CMS blog, etc.
Then create slack channel in here that makes it easy to follow/comment
completely agree
and if you did have a structured feed for that, I could then also do things with it in the extension
<https://getinsomnia.slack.com/apps/A0F7VRHCL-statuspageio>  it was made by the slack team
It actually seems like it's a built in feature. Maybe it just needs to be activated? Would be highly appreciated! <@U22PKFRU5> is that something you can look into?
I'll explore some options and see what we can do. We definitely want to improve communication/transparency with the dev community
is there a way to see what targeted message a chat visitor came from?

~for some odd reason (i never got them before) but i am getting messages about chats being assigned to me~ (looks like its a setting in the users notifications preferences under "Assign > Advanced Preferences"), I wanted to see if it was a targeted message that had a setting in it but was wondering if this info was available anywhere when you are looking at chats

Ok, I know this is not a HubSpot issue, but I'm stuck. I need help with a responsive design issue... Please tell me if that kind of questions is inappropriate in this community. I will understand. I would have asked on StackOverflow, but I wasn't able to reproduce my work on <http://codepen.io|codepen.io> since I work directly with the drag & drop editor.
If you want to help someone who is learning web development through HS, here is my question:
What would be the best way to make the overlaying purple video player displayed above the right column content on mobile for that page: <https://preview.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/template/multi?is_buffered_template_layout=true&portalId=608605&tc_deviceCategory=undefined&template_layout_id=6442846282&updated=1541555917155>
Thanks a lot for your help

<@UDU6KEBFB>
@media (max-width: 767px) {
.player-container { position: relative; }
}
over simplified but a start

we kinda use <#C22PJ878V|random> for non HS and non <#CBA9UA4EN|javascript> discussion, but not a big deal.

answering your question have a media query set the player to position relative.

That will get you 90% of the way

normally thought I would try to avoid positioning things absolutely in the way you did for the video - it will bite you in the butt in most cases because it makes responsive hard where as using floats will make it backward compatible. and easy to make responsive(you just remove the floats and set div to full width block

RE: Emails.
Do any of you know how to prevent the preview text in HubSpot from filling up with garbage? Our client really likes very short preview text. And is ready to quit HS if we cannot figure out how to prevent this issue. I’ve tried the `&nbsp;&zwnj;` hack in the code (though I may have done that incorrectly). And, I’ve tried adding blank spaces in the preview text box in the email UI. Nothing is working! Any help you can provide is greatly appreciated!
Which preview text are you talking about? In emails?
Correct, in emails.

Hey, thanks for your help! I tried what you suggested and it didn't work... :disappointed: In fact, nothing has changed. Any clues? Here is the URL again <https://preview.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/template/multi?is_buffered_template_layout=true&portalId=608605&tc_deviceCategory=undefined&template_layout_id=6442846282&updated=1541555917155>
I think she’s meaning the html email’s preview text, as in what shows in the email preview text you see in like google chrome

Basically that text is whatever your first text in your email is. Often people set that text to be visibly hidden in the email itself, that way they can have other text there.

Often if you do not intentionally place text up there your email header will be first and usually people have logos in there. when that happens they get the alt text in those preview sections
Yeah exactly. If you don't set a preview text yourself, Mail clients will take a defined number of characters from the beginning of the emails
including alt text and other undesired code
If you create your template using the drag&drop editor, users will have the ability to set a preview text when they edit email infos (from address, from name, subject)

If you're using a custom coded email template, you need to add this code to your template:

<div id="preview_text" style="display:none;font-size:1px;color:{{background_color}};line-height:1px;max-height:0px;max-width:0px;opacity:0;overflow:hidden;">{% text "preview_text" label="Preview Text", value="", no_wrapper=True %}</div>
Oh it works!
I just can't thank you enough.
Excuse my ignorance, but can you explain to me why I needed to select the same class twice here?
increases specificity
<https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2007/07/css-specificity-things-you-should-know/>

For anyone who missed :sprocket: HubSpot Developer Day 2018, we just released four session videos.
Thanks again to all those who presented and shared their coding :matrix: wisdom :pray:
> <https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/developer-day-2018-videos>
Already getting excited for next year :hamsterdance:
I knew about specificity, but wasn't aware that we could select the same class twice to increase it. Thank you!
yea it's a nice little trick

Thanks you so much for the reply. I do, in fact, have that code in my email template. The results aren’t what I’m looking for (see image). I’m wondering if there is any way to avoid the junk copy added in after the very short preview text.
